meanings.definition: A form of church music sung in unison without instrumental accompaniment.
meanings.sent1: The monks sang the plainchant beautifully during the church service.
meanings.sent2: The plainchant echoed through the cathedral, filling the space with sacred music.
meanings.sent3: The plainchant was so soothing that even the birds outside stopped to listen.
meanings.sent4: The pure voices of the choir transformed the plainchant into a heavenly melody.
meanings.sent5: The haunting plainchant lingered in the air long after the service ended.

meanings.definition: To sing or recite in plainchant.
meanings.sent1: She decided to plainchant the ancient hymn as a tribute to her ancestors.
meanings.sent2: The monks would often plainchant the prayers in the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to plainchant his way through the entire meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her voice plainchanted the words with such reverence that it moved everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The children plainchanted the nursery rhyme with enthusiasm and joy.
